page.title: 01Coast at Boulby and Staithes
page.content: Mostly sea, this block contains a small area of cast at Boulby as well as a headland at Staithes Cowbar Nab. At Staithes the 150ft high scrub covered nab dominates the harobur and old village. The Boulby end is atop 200ft high cliff sheer to the rocky inter tidal area below. The grassy farmland above has 3 houses. Beautiful views to the east of Staithes and Runswick from the Cleveland way footpath make this a popular area to visit, mostly by hikers on footpath and people visiting nearby Boulby cliffs, the highest in East England. There is a small cafe to cater to their needs which also acts as a census point for the travel. There is a Bed and Breakfast but most visitors continue to Staithes or are day visitors enjoying the unspoilt scenery (except for the nearby Boulby mine
